content.raw:
cmake version requirements (remember that Ubuntu 12.04 is [using cmake 2.8.7](http://packages.ubuntu.com/precise/cmake)):

[WriteBasicConfigVersionFile](https://github.com/Kitware/CMake/blob/v2.8.6/Modules/WriteBasicConfigVersionFile.cmake) is available in 2.8.6-2.8.7, available but deprecated for 2.8.8+ (still available in 3.0).

The [CMakePackageConfigHelpers](https://github.com/Kitware/CMake/blob/v2.8.8/Modules/CMakePackageConfigHelpers.cmake) is available in 2.88+ and is the recommended thing to use.

To keep support for 12.04, I think we should stick with WriteBasicConfigVersionFile for now and raise the minimum required cmake version to 2.8.6. In the future we can switch to CMakePackageConfigHelpers and raise the minimum cmake version to 2.8.8
